content: your work this is important to make sure your borders look as they should i prefer to end all row with the chain 3 for starting the next row so that it is easier to let it hang to the front or back the stitches interlocking filet uses very simple stitches the whole concept is 1dc 1ch skip 1 however the key is how that double_crochet is made either from the front dcif or from the back dcib of the work it is this that will bring colours front or send them to the back creating the pattern double_crochet in back also called back stitch - dcib working with colour a and when your colour a mesh is in front yarn over place the hook behind the colour b mesh and putting the hook through the back of the colour b mesh window insert the hook from front to back into the top 2 loops of the colour a double_crochet of the previous row pull the 2 loops of colour a through the colour b mesh window and to the back of the work and finish the double_crochet yarn over and pull through 2 yarn over and pull through last 2 loops note in the information below on how to get started steps 6 7 and 8 has photos on how a dcib is done working with colour a and when your colour a mesh is behind it is a pretty straight forward double_crochet double_crochet in front also called front stitch - dcif working with colour a and when your colour a mesh is behind yarn over place the hook in front of the colour b mesh and putting the hook through the colour b mesh window insert the hook from front to back into the top 2 loops of the colour a double_crochet of the previous row pull the 2 loops of colour a through the colour b mesh window and to the front of the work and finish the double_crochet yarn over and pull through 2 yarn over and pull through last 2 loops working with colour a and when your colour a mesh is in front it is a straightforward double_crochet © astrid schandy 2024 aschandy@yahoo no astrid s diagonals sample 8 the photo guide on how to get started the trellis is the name one of the names for the start of a project it consists of one row of a colour to which a row of b colour is added there are many ways of starting a project sometimes you weave the b chain through the a trellis others you stitch back and front others you just stitch on the back below is a photo guide on how to start this project this is just a small example in case you want to test it first with some left over yarn and any hook in order to understand how it works before you start though it is the same system as the start of this
